comments.body: Can we add `LIST JAR` in related statements?
comments.diffHunk:
@@ -19,4 +19,24 @@ license: | limitations under the License. --- -**This page is under construction** +### Description +`ADD JAR` adds a file, jar or archive to the list of resources. The added files can be listed using `LIST JAR`. + +### Syntax +{% highlight sql %} +ADD JAR file_name +{% endhighlight %} + +### Parameters +
+
file_name
+
The name of the file/jar/archive to be added. It could be either on a local file system or a HDFS.
+
+ +### Examples +{% highlight sql %} +ADD JAR t1; +{% endhighlight %} + +### Related Statements + * [ADD FILE](sql-ref-syntax-aux-resource-mgmt-add-file.html)

comments.body:
Nit: jar -> JAR
(it stands for Java ARchive)

comments.body: a HDFS -> a distributed file system
comments.diffHunk:
@@ -19,4 +19,26 @@ license: | limitations under the License. --- -**This page is under construction** +### Description +`ADD JAR` adds a jar file to the list of resources. The added jar file can be listed using [LIST JAR](sql-ref-syntax-aux-resource-mgmt-list-jar.html). + +### Syntax +{% highlight sql %} +ADD JAR file_name +{% endhighlight %} + +### Parameters +
+
file_name
+
The name of the jar file to be added. It could be either on a local file system or a HDFS.

comments.body:
Would adding a .txt file as a JAR really work? I guess it just puts it on the classpath like a JAR. If so, that's fine. It would be an unusual usage, so I am not sure if we should include it, but if it works it's not a big deal.

Here adding a .zip file also looks a little funny, though a JAR file is just a .zip file itself. Same comment, I wonder if we should show this?
comments.diffHunk:
@@ -19,4 +19,31 @@ license: | limitations under the License. --- -**This page is under construction** +### Description +`ADD JAR` adds a file, JAR or archive to the list of resources. The added file can be listed using [LIST JAR](sql-ref-syntax-aux-resource-mgmt-list-jar.html). + +### Syntax +{% highlight sql %} +ADD JAR file_name +{% endhighlight %} + +### Parameters +
+
file_name
+
The name of the file, JAR or archive to be added. It could be either on a local file system or a distributed file system.
+
+ +### Examples +{% highlight sql %} + add JAR /tmp/test1.jar; + + add JAR /tmp/test2.zip; + + ADD JAR /tmp/test3.txt;

comments.body: 'archive' here means a .zip archive only, right, and only because a JAR file is a .zip file? if all of these things are just put on the classpath, I'd hesitate to say you can add a general 'archive' unless it has a special function beyond just treating it as a JAR file (and I don't know if it does). If it's just .zip files, I'd say "ZIP archive"
